channel.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The servers run on port 43594 i think. but everytime a client loads, it always has a randomized port. I doubt it is truly possible to even get the same port on two clients.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @_1one_eleven1 !!1one!eleven1!
item.description:
@_1one_eleven1 wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

I don’t see how that is possible, some businesses and schools use boot-from-lan computers with absolutely no file write positions except to server… Thus runescape saves the UID to the server all computers log onto… Thus all computers as far as Jagex is concerned have the same UID and the same IP… Same could be said for many lan centers… and Sub-Net’s… It is a means of tracking but not an efficient one… Session tracking via webservlets on the jagex servers is FAR FAR FAR FAR more efficient!

I see where your coming from but what i meant was

2 accounts with same IP + UID interacting with each other. (but that still doesnt explain the above).

Should of worded it better

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:9, topic:107612”]And they do track via sessions, don’t let any “moron” convince you otherwise-> they keep track of advertisements, and who has seen what… and so on. They have to, to know exactly what to charge the people whom pay Jagex to advertise… For more information on Sessions, google “PHP sessions” or “JSP sessions”.

Hope this clears it up[/quote]

Yeah in the TOS they say they track pages you look at (not sure about ad impressions though).

EDIT: What about ports? same IP + UID + PORT.

What port does rs use and is it random?
If its static then a client running 2 clients would need 2 ports? Or does it use the same port, i dont know.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:107612”][quote author=pplsuqbawlz link=topic=154047.msg1485882#msg1485882 date=1181830779]
They have to, to know exactly what to charge the people whom pay Jagex to advertise…
[/quote]

I have no idea if they track using sessions, but JageX don’t track the ad impressions. Or rather, they might, but they wouldn’t need to use sessions to do that, and chances are the ad company also tracks their own impressions for obvious reasons. It’s not a very good reason to be using PHP sessions.[/quote]

Sessions don’t have anything to do with just “php”, and no they dont use PHP, im just saying google php sessions to get an idea of what they are… Oh and they do, ask Ollie if you can’t figure this out…

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

They have to, to know exactly what to charge the people whom pay Jagex to advertise…

I have no idea if they track using sessions, but JageX don’t track the ad impressions. Or rather, they might, but they wouldn’t need to use sessions to do that, and chances are the ad company also tracks their own impressions for obvious reasons. It’s not a very good reason to be using PHP sessions.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

[quote="!!1one!eleven1!, post:8, topic:107612"]I always thought the UID was for tracking a computer.

2 accounts with same IP + UID = ban[/quote]

I don’t see how that is possible, some businesses and schools use boot-from-lan computers with absolutely no file write positions except to server… Thus runescape saves the UID to the server all computers log onto… Thus all computers as far as Jagex is concerned have the same UID and the same IP… Same could be said for many lan centers… and Sub-Net’s… It is a means of tracking but not an efficient one… Session tracking via webservlets on the jagex servers is FAR FAR FAR FAR more efficient!

And they do track via sessions, don’t let any “moron” convince you otherwise-> they keep track of advertisements, and who has seen what… and so on. They have to, to know exactly what to charge the people whom pay Jagex to advertise… For more information on Sessions, google “PHP sessions” or “JSP sessions”.

Hope this clears it up

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

UID is a means of tracking legitimate users, as there id and systems wont change as far as jagex’s context… Or at least wont change often.

There used to be a bit more public info on this sort of thing back in kaitnieks.com.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

i_15_ is the storeid, the storeid changes depending on where you’re playing from.

so if it was an office test (from jagex), they would use a different cache dir to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Runescape folder + UID
item.dc:creator: @_1one_eleven1 !!1one!eleven1!
item.description:
@_1one_eleven1 wrote:

Could somone please explain to me what the variable i corresponds to?

My RS folder is usually c:/windows/.file_store_32/ or c:/windows/.file_store_34/. Where does it get those numbers from?

[code]public void method1145(int i, int i_5_, String string, int i_6_)
{
if (i_5_ < 95)
method1150(-19);
if (i < 32 || (i ^ 0xffffffff) < -35)
i = 32;
String[] strings = { “c:/rscache/”, “/rscache/”, “c:/windows/”,
“c:/winnt/”, “c:/”, aString1541, “/tmp/”, “” };
boolean bool = false;
String[] strings_7_ = { “.jagex_cache_” + i, “.file_store_” + i };

    // etc ....

   }[/code]

Read full topic
